intro: Ptychosperma multiramosum, commonly known as the Bornean arrowroot, is a tropical plant native to Southeast Asia. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of about 1–2 meters. The plant features large, arrowhead-shaped leaves that are often used in traditional medicine. Its rhizomes are edible and have a starchy texture similar to taro. Ptychosperma multiramosum thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in lowland rainforests.
